intro: Stellilabium amicorum, commonly known as the friendship star-labium, is a rare and intriguing plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep violet. The plant belongs to the family Orchidaceae, showcasing the typical complex morphology of orchids, including specialized roots and showy petals. Its growth habit is typically epiphytic, meaning it thrives by growing on the surfaces of trees without being parasitic. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral structure, it is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
